comments.creator: mozilla.org@timur.tabi.org
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; en-US; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20101123 SeaMonkey/2.0.11
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; en-US; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20101123 SeaMonkey/2.0.11

Sorry if this is a dupe, but there are hundreds of bug reports about print preview, and it's just too hard to sift through them all.

When attempting to print multiple messages, I select "Preview" instead of "Print".  Two problems occurs:

1) The print preview only shows the first message.
2) The rest of the messages are printed to the real printer (even though I only asked for a preview)

The second bug is probably a dupe of bug 87474.  


Reproducible: Always

comments.raw_text: It's probably the same underlying bug that causes both. Setting tentative dependency.
comments.text: It's probably the same underlying bug that causes both. Setting tentative dependency.

NOT reproducible with EN-US SeaMonkey 2.33.1 (German Language pack)  Gecko/20100101 Build 20150321194901 (Default Theme) on German WIN7 64bit

a) Menu 'File -> Preview' is inactive / greyed out
MAC (+Linux?) only?

Additional info
b) Print of 3 sequencing messages (sortorder: date)  form POP3 inbox (Same with IMAP inbox) will work fine, I tested with FreePDF, 3 pdf documents will be saved fro 3 selected messages

c) Version due to User Story

mozilla.org@timur.tabi.org
comments.text: Hmmm, I don't see the Print Preview menu item any more.  If I use the "Open PDF in Preview" option of the Print dialog, it seems to work.  So maybe this is fixed?
comments.raw_text: Hmmm, I don't see the Print Preview menu item any more.  If I use the "Open PDF in Preview" option of the Print dialog, it seems to work.  So maybe this is fixed?
